intro: Tromotriche choanantha, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by green bracts. Tromotriche choanantha is often found in open areas and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
